game:swordz-handbook-text:
The Swordz' handbook
This is still a WIP, will be used as a F.A.Q and will offer some basic info. The swordz mod attempts to add a bunch of new weapons (some from the base game only found as ruined variants) that are balanced and have additional functionality, swordz tries to find a nice middle-ground between realism and game-ism, E.G. needing whetstones to sharpen a blade but not going so hard at it that it requires you to sharpen said blade for minutes at a time. Hafts - Click me to see! Hafts, handles! You can use different metals (or sticks) for differing values/aesthetics on your weapons & tools. Whetstones - Click me to see! Use whetstones to make better sharper blades! * granite, sandstonesuevite * Still need to go back and add variants of blades for everything pre-1.1.2 Stainless Steel - Click me to see! Want something better than steel? Then you're gonna need to take your old steel and combine it with crushed chromite and manganese powder to make stainless steel in a cementary. Titanium - Want something even better than stainless teel? Try titanium. To refine the ilmenite, you're going to need manganese powder, lime, 20 ilmenite nuggets, and an ingot mold, this will make a prepared titanium ingot, which can then be put into the cementary. Feedback If you have any feedback, suggestions or complaints then please go to the mod page and make a comment : here Beyond here lies deep dwarvenly secrets. Lazh-zirak, Sabumuk, and Gazob, the three dwarvish metals of legend. One blue, one green and the last red, these three metals are said to be unbeatable in terms of strength and toughness...now if only you could find some, but even if you do..how do you refine them? There's also tales of another metal, ancient dwarven tales speak of a sky-metal, a metal so rare but so strong yet light that it puts both orichalcos and mithril to shame, Aithril they call it, but nobody knows if it exists.
itemdesc-swordzshortblade-*: A blade in desperate need of a handle.
itemdesc-swordzshort-*: A rather small sword that is multifunctional.
itemdesc-seaxblade-*: A seax blade that really rather needs a handle.
itemdesc-seax-*: A large knife that's rather utilitarian.
itemdesc-whetstone-*: A whetstone used to sharpen a blade.
itemdesc-haft-*: A metal handle in need of a head.
itemdesc-zweihander-*: A large and fearsome sword but onerous in maintenance
itemdesc-zweihanderblade-*: A large and expensive blade for a large and expensive sword.
itemcraftdesc-zweihanderblade-*: A large and expensive blade for a large and expensive sword.
item-sordblade-tinbronze-blunt: Blunt Tin Bronze Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-tinbronze-dull: Dull Tin Bronze Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-tinbronze-sharp: Sharp Tin Bronze Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-tinbronze-honed: Honed Tin Bronze Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-meteoriciron-blunt: Blunt Meteoric Iron Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-meteoriciron-dull: Dull Meteoric Iron Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-meteoriciron-sharp: Sharp Meteoric Iron Arming Sword Blade
item-sordblade-meteoriciron-honed: Honed Meteoric Iron Arming Sword Blade
itemdesc-sord-*: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.
itemdesc-sordblade-*: A blade for a knightly sword.
itemcraftdesc-sordblade-*: A blade for a knightly sword.
itemdesc-bearded-*: An axe that can be used as both a tool and a weapon.
itemdesc-beardedhead-*: An axehead for a bearded axe.
itemcraftdesc-beardedhead-*: An axehead for a bearded axe.
itemdesc-nadziak-*: A Nadziak, a type of warhammer with a downward facing spike.
itemdesc-nadziakhead-*: A head for a gruesome warpick.
itemcraftdesc-nadziakhead-*: A head for a gruesome warpick.
itemdesc-pernach-*: A pernach, this flanged mace is quite durable and effective against armour.
item-becdecorbinhead-meteoriciron: Meteoric Iron Bec de corbin head
itemdesc-becdecorbin-*: The raven's beak warhammer, a type of polearm
itemdesc-warscythe-*: A rather crude polearm but doubtlessly effective.
itemdesc-stiletto-*: A flimsy and a rather deceptively dangerous weapon.
itemcraftdesc-stilettoblade-*: A blade for a small yet dangerous weapon.
itemdesc-spatha-*: A Spatha, and olde and effective sword design.
itemdesc-gladius-*: A gladius, a smaller sword good at both stabbing and slashing.
itemdesc-ranseur-*: Ranseurs, also known as a roncone are quite effective polearms, whether it be against a mounted adversary or on foot.
itemdesc-padded: A padded cudgel, for when you really need to whack something without killing it.
itemdesc-sabre-*: A curved sword that's excellent at cutting, although they tend to be a bit fragile compared to straight blades.
itemdesc-sabreblade-*: A curved blade in need of an appropriate handle
itemdesc-kilij-*: A curved sword that's excellent at cutting, although they tend to be a bit fragile compared to straight blades.
itemdesc-kilijblade-*: A curved blade in need of an appropriate handle
itemdesc-boarspear-*: A spear that was designed to hunt dangerous creatures like it's name sake, it has a pair of wings on the socket to help prevent injury to the user.
itemdesc-voulge-*: An old weapon design that is nontheless effective.
itemdesc-daneaxe-*: A two-handed axe that is purportedly able to hew a man in two.
itemdesc-atgeir-*: An old viking polearm, also known as a mail-piercer.
itemdesc-longsword-*: A Longsword also known as a hand-and-a-half sword, they're able to be used with one or two hands.
itemdesc-longswordblade-*: A blade in need of an appropriate handle
itemdesc-warhammer-*: A warhammer, a weapon good against flesh and armour.
itemdesc-warhammerhead-*: A head for a gruesome warhammer.
itemcraftdesc-warhammerhead-*: A head for a gruesome warhammer.
itemdesc-naginata-*: A Naginata, a weapon design that hails from a distant land.
itemdesc-manganesepowder: A powder made from pulverized rhodochrosite ore
itemdesc-ingot-preparedstainless: A steel ingot that's been prepared to be turned into stainless steel by being powdered with chromite and manganese.
itemdesc-ingot-preparedtitanium: This prepared titanium ingot is ready to be put into a cementary to be turned into something usable.
itemdesc-ingot-preparedmithril: This prepared mithril ingot is ready to be put into a cementary to be turned into something usable.
itemdesc-ingot-preparedadamant: This prepared adamant ingot is ready to be put into a cementary to be turned into something usable.
itemdesc-ingot-preparedorichalcum: This prepared orichalcos ingot is ready to be put into a cementary to be turned into something usable.
itemdesc-ingot-preparedaithril: This prepared aithril ingot is ready to be put into a cementary to be turned into something usable.
itemdesc-tunneler-*: This handy-dandy tool can mine a 1x2
itemdesc-tunnelerhead-*: This tunneler head needs a metal haft to be finished
itemcraftdesc-tunnelerhead-*: A Tunneler Head , for a tool that mines a 1x2
itemdesc-sledgehammer-*: This handy-dandy tool can mine a 3x3, be warned however as it only mines stone, and gives less than a pickaxe.
itemdesc-sledgehammerhead-*: This Sledgehammer head needs a metal haft to be finished
itemcraftdesc-sledgehammerhead-*: A Sledgehammer Head , for a tool that mines a 3x3
itemdesc-excavator: This handy-dandy tool can dig a 2x3 in soft materials like dirt, be warned however as there's a small amount of waste compared to a shovel.
itemdesc-excavatorhead-*: This Excavator head needs a metal haft to be finished
itemcraftdesc-excavatorhead-*: A Excavator Head , for a tool that digs a 2x3
itemdesc-armor-*-*-mithril: The fabled metal makes this armor feel almost like you're wearing nothing at all
itemdesc-armor-*-*-orichalcum: The fabled metal this is fashioned from awfully cumbersome.
itemdesc-armor-*-*-aithril: Aithril, it is believed that this is mithril in a purified form, possible only from finding a gift from the heavens.
itemdesc-pila-*: An old but still very effective weapon, great at puncturing shields.
itemdesc-pilahead-*: Pilum heads for a disposable javelin
blockdesc-bigbomb: A bomb with a bigger blast radius and effective against stone.
blockdesc-largebomb: A bomb with a larger blast radius, pretty dangerous, you should run.
itemdesc-trainingdummy: This training dummy is perfect for target practice, venting your frustration on or just as a decoration!
swordz:itemdesc-mithrilbloom: This bloom requires further processing to be turned into something usable.
game:itemdesc-ingot-mithril: Mithril, also known as Lazh-zirak in Dwarvish is an incredibly lightweight and strong material, the stuff of legends.
game:itemdesc-ingot-unfoldedmithril: Due to the poor quality of the refined metal from blooming the mithril, it requires further work by folding it on an anvil.
game:itemdesc-ingot-adamant: An extremely strong and rare metal that is slightly lighter than steel but much stronger.
game:itemdesc-ingot-orichalcum: This insanely heavy metal is equally as strong, but it's weight might limit it's usefulness
game:itemdesc-nugget-aithril: Small pieces of a peculiar metal
game:itemdesc-ingot-aithril: This metal is said to originate from the heavens.
